result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Sarah St John
Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Defendant Hector De La Fuente Pantoja in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Hector De La Fuente Pantoja.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter St John previously sworn by clerk. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Information filed. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on October 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Judge's response to Defense letter of Conflict filed on 8/25/22 - 
 
**1. take matter off calendar 2. set for waiver of prelim and ARR in 45 days 3. defendant must appear in person per previous order of the court **KED 8/29/22
- conflict of counsel
Arraignment on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bruce Goodman

2:38PM (64-06) Defendant Hector De La Fuente Pantoja not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Samuel Berg in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Hector De La Fuente Pantoja.
Statement given by Attorney Ahmad why he and his client did not appear last hearing via zoom and also why defendant is not in court today. Interpreter Bruce Goodman in court at 2PM. 
Court has discussion with Attorney Ahmad on the age of this case,  and the need to have it move forward. Court also address that an interpreter was requested for the defendant in this case again. Attorney Ahmad is requesting Waiver of Prelim, Arraignment be held before the Judge in this case.
No objection by the State.

Court will require petitioner and attorney to appear in person for next hearing. No Zoom or Phone allowed.

Spanish Interpreter needed for defendant.

Adj. 2:16PM
Waiver of Preliminary hearing was not held. See adjourned Initial Appearance Minutes on 8/1/22

Instructions for How to Appear Remotely - Preliminary Hearing - April 8, 2022 at 3:00 pm
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH F.C. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J.
